heading: # Menus
headingText: The `v-menu` component shows a menu at the position of the element used to activate it.

usage.desc: Remember to put the element that activates the menu in the `activator` slot.

absolute.heading: ### Absolute position
absolute.desc: Menus can also be placed absolutely on top of the activator element using the `absolute` prop. Try clicking anywhere on the image.

disabled.heading: ### Disabled
disabled.desc: You can disable the menu. Disabled menus can't be opened.

offset-x.heading: ### X offset
offset-x.desc: Menu can be offset by the X axis to make the activator visible.

offset-y.heading: ### Y offset
offset-y.desc: Menu can be offset by the Y axis to make the activator visible.

close-on-click.heading: ### Close on click
close-on-click.desc: Menu can be closed when lost focus.

close-on-content-click.heading: ### Close on content click
close-on-content-click.desc: You can configure whether `v-menu` should be closed when its content is clicked.

absolute-without-activator.heading: ### Absolute position without activator
absolute-without-activator.desc: Menus can also be used without an activator by using `absolute` together with the props `position-x` and `position-y`. Try right-clicking anywhere on the image.

menu-activator-tooltip.heading: ### Menu with activator and tooltip
menu-activator-tooltip.desc: With the new `v-slot` syntax, nested activators such as those seen with a `v-menu` and `v-tooltip` attached to the same activator button, need a particular setup in order to function correctly. **Note: this same syntax is used for other nested activators such as `v-dialog` w/ `v-tooltip`.**

hover.heading: ### Hover
hover.desc: Menus can be accessed using hover instead of clicking with the `open-on-hover` prop.

menus.heading: ### Menus
menus.desc: Menus can be placed within almost any component.

custom-transition.heading: ### Custom transitions
custom-transition.desc: Vuetify comes with 3 standard transitions, **scale**, **slide-x** and **slide-y**. You can also create your own and pass it as the transition argument. For an example of how the stock transitions are constructed, visit [here](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/blob/master/packages/vuetify/src/util/helpers.ts).

popover.heading: ### Popover menu
popover.desc: A menu can be configured to be static when opened, allowing it to function as a popover. This can be useful when there are multiple interactive items within the menu contents.

accessibility.desc: By default, `v-menu` components are _detached_ and moved to the root of your application. In order to properly support [inserting dynamic content into the DOM](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Techniques/client-side-script/SCR26), you _must_ use the **attach** prop. This will ensure that focus transfers from the activator to the content when pressing the <kbd>tab</kbd> key.

props.closeOnClick: Designates if menu should close on outside-activator click
props.closeOnContentClick: Designates if menu should close when its content is clicked
props.closeDelay: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop
props.offsetX: Offset the menu on the x-axis. Works in conjunction with direction left/right
props.offsetY: Offset the menu on the y-axis. Works in conjunction with direction top/bottom
props.maxHeight: Sets the max height of the menu content
props.openDelay: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop
props.openOnClick: Designates whether menu should open on activator click
props.openOnHover: Designates whether menu should open on activator hover
props.returnValue: The value that is updated when the menu is closed - must be primitive. Dot notation is supported
